name: GM Dashboard: A Man of the People (Quickstart)
content:
GM Quickstart

Source: A Man of the People (2E), pp.4-26.

Use this page as your one-screen operations board before session start.

Compendiums to Open

  • Servant Cases (packs/servant.db): narrative walk-through and source appendix.
  • Servant NPCs (packs/servant-npcs.db): all major and scene-critical actors, including Jamie Smyth (Possessed).
  • Servant Tables (packs/servant-tables.db): scene sequencer, complications, escalation clocks, and aftermath fallout.

Recommended Session Flow

  1. Roll once on Scene Sequencer to set opening emphasis.
  2. Run Act One office search and, if needed, roll Office Search Leads.
  3. At Milton Keynes, use Icebreaker Pressure Prompts to define each PC voice.
  4. Trigger possession practical and escalate with Demonology Practical Complications.
  5. In Parliament, pick or roll Entry Routes and Amateur Occultist Obstacles.
  6. During chamber shutdown, advance Grid Shutdown Escalation each failed attempt.
  7. Close with Bureaucratic Fallout and assign follow-up KPIs.

Prep Checklist

  • Preload actor sheets: Nicholas, Algernon, Melanie, Jamie, Boris, Wilfred, Angela.
  • Pin one table per act to favorites for faster rolling.
  • Keep one handout image ready per act for tone shifts.
  • Decide in advance how harshly command handles accreditation violations.

GM Principle: keep pressure on time, optics, and paperwork at the same time.

name: A Man of the People: Adventure Summary (p.4-6)
content:
A Man of the People

Source: The Laundry Roleplaying Game - A Man of the People (2E), pp.4-6.

Man of the People is a short introductory adventure for The Laundry Roleplaying Game. It is structured in three acts designed to showcase setting tone, procedural absurdity, occult risk, and dark bureaucracy.

Act One: On Her Majesty's Sub-optimal Service

  • The Players search politician Nicholas Morris' office for incriminating occult material.
  • The operation goes wrong, they are caught in the act, and reprimanded.
  • Their field certification is revoked pending retraining.

Act Two: Welcome to Sunny Milton Keynes

  • The Players are sent to mandatory retraining in Milton Keynes.
  • Corporate icebreakers and institutional humiliation establish tone.
  • A computational demonology practical goes wrong and must be contained.
  • Emergency recall sends everyone back to London.

Act Three: Going Underground

  • The Players are assigned to support monitoring from the Special Operations Room.
  • Team A and Team B are neutralised; the Players become the last available response.
  • They must enter Parliament, neutralise amateur occult interference, stop IAN GUNPOWDER, and disable the active grid.

Core theme: the team is forced from humiliation to decisive action while bureaucracy, panic, ego, and the occult collide in central London.

name: Background and Major NPCs (p.6-7)
content:
Background

Source: pp.6-7.

Politician Nicholas Morris is impatient to gain power and convinced the current government cannot be allowed to continue. Disgruntled Laundry employee Algernon Mainwaring uncovers plans for an influencing grid in the House of Commons and offers Morris a way to force political outcomes. Morris starts probing occult circles and attracts amateur sorcerers; one contact tips off the Laundry.

The Laundry has limited specifics but treats the combination of politician + mind control + occult network as a high-risk threat indicator.

Major NPCs

Nicholas Morris

A credible and committed politician whose urgency has become dangerous. He believes he is acting for the country, but ambition and control are driving him.

Algernon Mainwaring

Arcana Analysis administrator (Counter Possession), nearly 30 years in service, repeatedly denied effective progression to field status. Grievance and need for recognition shape his decisions.

General Douglas Fairchild

MOD planner who enjoys intimidation theatre and strategic pressure. Performs bluster as a social weapon.

Melanie Rerio

Ambitious, competitive, and actively hostile to perceived underperformers. Assigned as trainer despite preferring field advancement; resents the posting and takes satisfaction in Player humiliation.

name: Act One: On Her Majesty's Sub-optimal Service (p.8-10)
content:
Opening Situation

Source: pp.8-10.

The team enters Portcullis House under an IT/infrastructure cover identity and begins searching Nicholas Morris' office while the assistant is out. The scene should be played as quick, active, and darkly comic.

Office Contents

  • Modern office with cluttered desk and meeting area.
  • Newspaper clippings on Morris' anti-government speeches.
  • Packed filing cupboards, archive boxes, old peripherals, and operational noise.
  • Mugs with evolving coffee mould lifeforms.

Search Guidance

Run a DN 4:1 Mind (Awareness) test for useful findings. Play false positives and bureaucratic absurdity heavily: FOI requests, conspiracy-adjacent references, and suspicious-but-inconclusive material.

Safe Detail

Combination is trivially guessable (0378; DOB MMYY) and duplicated on a post-it note. Contents are mundane.

Loadout Reminder

This is not a combat deployment: IDs, evidence containers, empty toolboxes/laptop bags, and contractor cover assets.

name: Act One Scene: Busted! and Warrant Card - REVOKED (p.11)
content:
Busted!

Source: p.11.

Algernon Mainwaring bursts in warning that the operation is compromised, followed by Nicholas Morris, General Fairchild, and security. Let the General dominate the scene with aggressive theatrical outrage and constant interruption. If the team resists, security suppresses and extracts them.

Tone Targets

  • Institutional panic and public embarrassment.
  • British absurdity under pressure.
  • No tactical escape route that preserves mission optics.

Immediate Fallout: Warrant Card - REVOKED

After HR interviews, reprimands, and paperwork, the team is removed from active field duty and ordered to repeat mandatory retraining in Milton Keynes before re-accreditation.

Transition Hook: 'A week in Milton Keynes should prove sufficient.'

name: Act Two: Welcome to Sunny Milton Keynes (p.12-13)
content:
Training Facility Setup

Source: pp.12-13.

The Laundry's Milton Keynes training site is intentionally mundane and dispiriting: concrete office architecture, flickering lights, stale institutional smell, and procedural fatigue.

Key Beats

  • Re-establish the PCs as low-status personnel.
  • Use Melanie Rerio as pressure, mockery, and competitive hostility.
  • Present retraining as both punishment and pipeline control.
  • Foreshadow later crisis escalation.

Recommended GM Emphasis

  • Break-time logistics as micro-horror (toilets vs biscuits).
  • Performative professionalism masking resentment.
  • Course compliance culture versus real-world threat demands.

name: Act Two Scene: Corporate Icebreakers (p.14)
content:
Corporate Icebreakers

Source: p.14.

Melanie opens with performative success talk and immediately pressures the PCs to explain why they are on the course. Run this as a social stress scene with controlled humiliation and small opportunities for character definition.

NPC Participation

  • Jamie Smyth (OCCULUS Support): aggressive, explicit confidence, disciplinary history, high capability.
  • Algernon Mainwaring: eager to belong, earnest, unexpectedly humanising comic beats.

Scene Goal

Give each Player one personal line that frames how they handle institutional failure: deflect, own it, blame process, or escalate.

name: Act Two Scene: Computational Demonology Refresher (p.15)
content:
Lecture and Fatigue

Source: p.15.

A VHS lecture covers computational demonology basics: computational pathways, alternate casting methods, active grid handling, and disruption risks. Ask all PCs for DN 4:1 Mind (Resolve); failure means they fall asleep during briefing-critical content.

Safety Notes Repeated in Material

  • Wear personal wards.
  • Do not touch active spell elements.
  • Do not cross active pentacle/summoning lines.
  • Shut down computation source to terminate active process.

Practical Incident

Melanie leaves the room; Jamie accidentally enters the active summoning pattern and is possessed. The team must contain and terminate the active setup quickly (power cut or destructive interruption of processor).

Encounter Stat Reference: Jamie Smyth (Possessed)

Attributes: Body 2, Mind 2, Spirit 1. Toughness: 1. Skills: Awareness +1d6, Close Combat +1d6, Fortitude +2d6. Attack: Teeth/Fingernails, 1d6, 1+S Damage, Ineffective, Piercing.

name: Act Two Scene: Q Division - Advancements in Laundry Technology (p.16-18)
content:
Q Division Demonstration

Source: pp.16-18.

After lunch, Dr Wilfred Maunder/Oxbridge presents sanctioned unconventional technology. Use this as a controlled systems tutorial before operational escalation.

Featured Equipment

Hand of Glory (HOG)

Temporarily renders the user unnoticeable (including electronic observation) while active. Pigeon-foot variants are compact but short duration. If user is in skin contact, up to two additional people may be covered.

Basilisk Camera (SCORPION STARE class)

Lethal gorgonism-derived weapon. Opaque barriers block line of sight effects. Mirrors can reflect attacks and may destroy basilisk devices if reflected back.

NecronomiPhone

Occult app platform for practical spell execution. In this mission context the available app set is restricted to Banishment, Ward, Exorcism.

Scene Objective

Ensure Players understand what each device can solve before emergency redeployment.

name: Act Two Finale: How Alarming, Return to London, Briefing (p.19-20)
content:
How Alarming

Source: pp.19-20.

A breathless recall message interrupts training: all available personnel are ordered back to London. The relocation logistics contrast hierarchy and status (Melanie gets rapid transit; others get a decaying minibus).

Boris Briefing

At the New Annex, Boris assigns emergency teams:

  • Team A: intercept at Parliament.
  • Team B: intercept at Morris' residence route.
  • Team C (PCs): no field deployment due accreditation status; support from Metropolitan CCTV Operations and stand by for SCORPION STARE contingencies.

Morris is assigned codename IAN GUNPOWDER. Situation is treated as potential existential threat until disproven.

name: Act Three: Going Underground and Special Operations Room (p.21-22)
content:
Special Operations Room

Source: pp.21-22.

The team monitors London CCTV feeds from the Laundry-adjacent control space. Run DN 4:1 Mind (Awareness) to spot Nicholas entering Parliament.

Escalation

  • Team A deploys and is neutralised by police after presenting warrant cards.
  • Team B is out of position and delayed.
  • A DN 4:2 Mind (Awareness or Technology) can confirm no other rapid-response assets are in time.

Boris then authorises Team C for direct action regardless of prior accreditation status.

Entry Routes to Parliament

  • Main entrance (high police exposure; warrant optics compromised).
  • Whitehall tunnel network.
  • Westminster station secure access timing exploit.
  • Thames-side wall/terrace approach.

name: Act Three Scenes: Parliament, Amateur Occultists, and the Grid (p.23-25)
content:
Inside Parliament

Source: pp.23-25.

Once inside, the team encounters layered delay actors and low-competence occult obstruction while a broad affective field pushes the sensation that everything is fine and intervention is unnecessary. Ward activation should counter that pressure.

Encounter Chain

  • Ominous Oliver: theatrical corridor blocker, light magical framing.
  • Bloody Duncan setup: fake/ineffective warding visual noise.
  • Linda and Martin: ideologically compliant amateurs outside the Commons chamber.

Commons Chamber Confrontation

Nicholas stands at the dispatch box while MPs are held in an unstable hypnotic state. Algernon covers the room with a basilisk gun and attempts to continue operation while searching instructions and justifying his grievance.

The Grid

The chamber floor pattern and smoking processor stack indicate a summoning-like computational grid. PCs can navigate to the core and disable the computation source.

  • Movement and safe positioning may require tactical sequencing.
  • Processor shutdown is a high-pressure technical action: suggested DN 6:2 Mind (Computers) under worsening environmental cues.
  • Delays increase risk to entranced MPs.

Neutralise Algernon, power down the grid, and recover chamber control before collateral catastrophe.

name: Conclusion and XP Awards (p.26)
content:
Conclusion

Source: p.26.

Team B and command arrive as the chamber is stabilised. Senior Plumber Angela Davies handles political containment and narrative control. Nicholas is extracted for intelligence handling. Final disciplinary outcome for the PCs depends on conduct and procedural compliance under pressure.

Default Rewards

  • 2 XP for mission completion.
  • +1 XP if all team members survive.
  • +1 XP if the grid is shut down directly by the team (without requiring rescue handoff).

Post-Action Tone

Regardless of success, conclude on Laundry-style administrative horror: after-action review, procedural accountability, and potential redeployment versus renewed corrective training.
